rows.name: Mal√©
rows.overview: Mal√© is the heart of the Maldives, serving as the political, economic, and cultural center. The city is home to the stunning Grand Friday Mosque, colorful local markets, and numerous restaurants and shops. Despite being densely populated, Mal√© offers authentic Maldivian culture and is an excellent starting point for exploring the islands.
rows.flightInfo: Accessible via Velana International Airport (MLE) or regional airports. Domestic flights available to nearby airports. Transfer time: 15-45 minutes by speedboat from airport.
rows.speedboatInfo: Speedboat transfers available from Male to this island. Journey time varies from 15-45 minutes depending on distance. Speedboat capacity: 30-50 passengers. Cost: USD $15-$50 per person.
rows.ferryInfo: Public ferry service available with multiple daily departures. Ferry journey time: 30 minutes to 2 hours. Capacity: 100-200 passengers. Cost: USD $1-$5 per person. Schedules vary by season.
rows.topThingsToDo: [{"emoji":"üïå","title":"Explore the Grand Friday Mosque (Masjid-al-Sultan Muhammad Thakurufaanu Al Auzam)","description":"Visit the largest mosque in the Maldives, an impressive architectural marvel with a golden dome that is a significant cultural and religious landmark."},{"emoji":"üè™","title":"Wander through the Local Market (Mal√© Local Market)","description":"Immerse yourself in local life by exploring the bustling market, offering fresh produce, local snacks, and a glimpse into daily Maldivian commerce."},{"emoji":"üê†","title":"Visit the Mal√© Fish Market","description":"Witness the daily catch brought in by local fishermen and observe the vibrant trade of various fresh seafood, a true insight into the island's primary industry."},{"emoji":"üèõÔ∏è","title":"Discover the National Museum","description":"Delve into the rich history and cultural heritage of the Maldives through a collection of artifacts, royal antiquities, and historical exhibits."},{"emoji":"üèñÔ∏è","title":"Stroll along Artificial Beach","description":"Relax at Mal√©'s only man-made beach, popular among locals for swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying the city's waterfront atmosphere."},{"emoji":"üê†","title":"Take a Submarine Tour","description":"Experience the underwater world of the Maldives without getting wet, exploring coral reefs and marine life from the comfort of a tourist submarine."},{"emoji":"üë•","title":"Dine at a Local Maldivian Restaurant","description":"Savor authentic Maldivian cuisine, from fresh seafood curries to traditional 'Garudhiya' (fish broth), at one of the many local eateries."},{"emoji":"üö∂","title":"Walk through Sultan Park and the Islamic Centre","description":"Enjoy a peaceful stroll through the green oasis of Sultan Park, located adjacent to the impressive Islamic Centre, offering a moment of tranquility amidst the city bustle."}]
rows.nearbyAirports: [{"code": "MLE", "description": "Accessible via Velana International Airport (MLE) or regional airports. Domestic flights available to nearby airports. Transfer time: 15-45 minutes by speedboat from airport.", "distance": "50-100 km", "duration": "1-2 hours", "name": "Mal√© International Airport", "transferType": "Speedboat"}]
rows.nearbyDiveSites: [{"name":"Banana Reef","distance":"12 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"One of the oldest and most famous dive sites in the Maldives, known for its vibrant corals, diverse fish life including Napoleon wrasse, reef sharks, and barracudas. Strong currents can be present."},{"name":"HP Reef (Girifushi Thila)","distance":"15 km","difficulty":"Advanced","description":"A protected marine area renowned for its soft corals in various hues of blue, yellow, and purple. Strong currents often attract large pelagic species like grey reef sharks and eagle rays."},{"name":"Mal√© Atoll Manta Point (Lankanfinolhu Faru)","distance":"18 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"A popular cleaning station for majestic manta rays, especially during the southwest monsoon season (May-November). Also features diverse reef fish and corals."},{"name":"Kuda Haa","distance":"10 km","difficulty":"Beginner/Intermediate","description":"A small, beautiful thila (underwater pinnacle) with gentle currents, perfect for beginners and photographers. Abundant with schooling fish, anemones, and clownfish."},{"name":"Victory Wreck","distance":"8 km","difficulty":"Advanced","description":"The wreck of the 'Maldivian Victory', a cargo ship that sank in 1981. It lies upright at 35 meters, encrusted with corals and home to many fish species. Requires good buoyancy control due to currents."}]
rows.nearbySurfSpots: [{"name":"Chickens","distance":"14 km","difficulty":"Intermediate/Advanced","description":"A long, fast left-hand wave breaking over a shallow reef. Known for its long rides and barrels, best surfed on a medium to large swell with south-east winds."},{"name":"Cokes","distance":"15 km","difficulty":"Advanced","description":"A powerful, hollow right-hand wave that breaks over a shallow reef. Famous for its thick barrels and challenging sections, suitable for experienced surfers."},{"name":"Sultans","distance":"13 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"A consistent right-hand wave offering long, peeling rides with multiple sections. It's known for being less crowded than Cokes and Chickens, suitable for various skill levels."}]

rows.name: Maamigili
rows.overview: Maamigili is a local island in Alifu Dhaalu Atoll, home to Villa International Airport. The island offers authentic Maldivian experiences with local communities, traditional fishing practices, and access to pristine diving sites. It serves as a gateway to the central-south atolls.
rows.quickFacts: {"type":"Local Island","knownFor":"Villa Airport, local culture, diving","bestFor":"Authentic experiences, diving","averageTemperature":"28-30¬∞C","waterTemperature":"26-29¬∞C","accommodation":"Guesthouses","mainLanguage":"Dhivehi, English","airport":"Villa International Airport (VAM)"}
rows.flightInfo: Accessible via Velana International Airport (MLE) or regional airports. Domestic flights available to nearby airports. Transfer time: 15-45 minutes by speedboat from airport.
rows.speedboatInfo: Speedboat transfers available from Male to this island. Journey time varies from 15-45 minutes depending on distance. Speedboat capacity: 30-50 passengers. Cost: USD $15-$50 per person.
rows.ferryInfo: Public ferry service available with multiple daily departures. Ferry journey time: 30 minutes to 2 hours. Capacity: 100-200 passengers. Cost: USD $1-$5 per person. Schedules vary by season.
rows.topThingsToDo: [{"emoji":"ü§ø","title":"Whale Shark Snorkeling Excursion","description":"Embark on a boat trip to the South Ari Atoll Marine Protected Area (SAMPA), a renowned spot for swimming alongside majestic whale sharks, the gentle giants of the ocean."},{"emoji":"üë•","title":"Maamigili Local Island Tour","description":"Wander through the local streets of Maamigili, observe daily life, interact with residents, and experience the authentic culture of a Maldivian fishing community."},{"emoji":"üèÑ","title":"PADI Certified Diving at Local Reefs","description":"Explore the vibrant underwater world of Alifu Dhaalu Atoll with certified dives to pristine reefs, encountering diverse marine life including colorful corals, reef sharks, and turtles."},{"emoji":"üê†","title":"Sunset Fishing Trip","description":"Join local fishermen on a traditional Dhoni boat as the sun sets, learning Maldivian hand-line fishing techniques and trying your luck at catching dinner."},{"emoji":"üéØ","title":"Kayaking or Stand-Up Paddleboarding","description":"Rent a kayak or stand-up paddleboard and explore the calm, turquoise lagoons surrounding Maamigili at your own pace, enjoying the serenity of the ocean."},{"emoji":"üèñÔ∏è","title":"Beach Relaxation and Stargazing","description":"Spend a peaceful evening on the island's secluded beaches, enjoying the tranquility and gazing at the brilliant, unpolluted night sky filled with stars."},{"emoji":"üéØ","title":"Visit Villa International Airport (VAM)","description":"Observe the operations of a local airport, watch seaplanes take off and land, and experience the unique atmosphere of a small island aviation hub."}]
rows.faq: [{"question":"What is Villa Airport used for?","answer":"Villa Airport serves domestic flights connecting Maamigili to Male and other atolls."},{"question":"Is Maamigili a resort island?","answer":"No, Maamigili is a local island with guesthouses and local accommodations, offering authentic experiences."}]
rows.nearbyAirports: [{"code": "MLE", "description": "Accessible via Velana International Airport (MLE) or regional airports. Domestic flights available to nearby airports. Transfer time: 15-45 minutes by speedboat from airport.", "distance": "50-100 km", "duration": "1-2 hours", "name": "Mal√© International Airport", "transferType": "Speedboat"}]
rows.nearbyDiveSites: [{"name":"Whale Shark Point (Maamigili Beyru)","distance":"1 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"Famous for frequent whale shark sightings, especially during specific seasons. A gentle drift dive along the reef edge."},{"name":"Kudimaa Wreck","distance":"3 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"A purposely sunk fishing trawler now home to a vibrant array of marine life including batfish, snappers, and glassfish. Max depth around 28m."},{"name":"Broken Rock","distance":"8 km","difficulty":"Advanced","description":"A unique dive site featuring a large, split rock formation creating a canyon. Strong currents can be present, attracting grey reef sharks and eagle rays."},{"name":"Reethi Thila","distance":"12 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"A beautiful pinnacle dive with diverse coral formations and abundant reef fish. Look out for schooling fusiliers and occasional pelagics."},{"name":"Dhiggiri Outreef","distance":"6 km","difficulty":"Beginner","description":"A shallow, protected reef perfect for beginners and snorkelers, offering colorful corals and small reef sharks."}]
rows.nearbySurfSpots: [{"name":"Maamigili Right","distance":"0.5 km","difficulty":"Beginner/Intermediate","description":"A relatively mellow right-hand wave breaking over a reef, suitable for longboarders and beginners on smaller days. Accessible directly from the island."},{"name":"Broken Rock Left","distance":"8 km","difficulty":"Intermediate/Advanced","description":"A powerful left-hand reef break that can offer long rides and barrels on the right swell. Requires a boat transfer."},{"name":"Dhiggiri Pass","distance":"7 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"A fun, consistent right-hander that works well on medium swells. Can be a good alternative when other spots are too big or small."}]

rows.name: Maaya Thila
rows.overview: Maaya Thila is a world-class dive site featuring dramatic underwater topography with vertical walls and overhangs. Known for encounters with large pelagic species including sharks and rays. Strong currents make it suitable for experienced divers.
rows.quickFacts: {"type":"dive","difficulty":"advanced","maxDepth":"60m","waterTemperature":"26-29¬∞C","visibility":"25-40 meters","bestSeason":"March to May","marineLife":"Sharks, rays, groupers, trevally, barracuda, fusiliers, snappers"}
rows.flightInfo: Accessible via Velana International Airport (MLE) or regional airports. Domestic flights available to nearby airports. Transfer time: 15-45 minutes by speedboat from airport.
rows.speedboatInfo: Speedboat transfers available from Male to this island. Journey time varies from 15-45 minutes depending on distance. Speedboat capacity: 30-50 passengers. Cost: USD $15-$50 per person.
rows.ferryInfo: Public ferry service available with multiple daily departures. Ferry journey time: 30 minutes to 2 hours. Capacity: 100-200 passengers. Cost: USD $1-$5 per person. Schedules vary by season.
rows.topThingsToDo: [{"emoji":"üèÑ","title":"Advanced Night Diving","description":"Experience the thrill of Maaya Thila's nocturnal marine life, including hunting reef sharks and moray eels, under the cover of darkness. This dive requires excellent buoyancy control and comfort with strong currents."},{"emoji":"üèÑ","title":"Daytime Pelagic Dive","description":"Descend into the depths of Maaya Thila to encounter large pelagic species such as grey reef sharks, white-tip reef sharks, and eagle rays. The strong currents make for exhilarating drift dives."},{"emoji":"üíß","title":"Underwater Photography Expedition","description":"Capture stunning images of Maaya Thila's diverse marine ecosystem, from schooling fish to dramatic coral formations and large sharks. This activity is best for divers with advanced photography skills and experience in strong currents."},{"emoji":"üèÑ","title":"Marine Biology Observation Dive","description":"Focus on identifying and observing the various species inhabiting Maaya Thila, including nudibranchs, frogfish, and different coral types, amidst the larger pelagic action. Requires good diving skills to maintain position."},{"emoji":"üèÑ","title":"Drift Diving Experience","description":"Embrace the powerful currents that define Maaya Thila, allowing them to carry you along the reef walls for an effortless yet thrilling dive. This requires comfort with drift diving techniques and current management."},{"emoji":"üèÑ","title":"Deep Dive Exploration","description":"Explore the deeper sections of Maaya Thila's thila, venturing beyond recreational limits (with appropriate certification) to discover unique marine life and formations. This activity is for highly experienced technical divers."}]
rows.faq: [{"question":"What is the difficulty level?","answer":"advanced"},{"question":"What is the maximum depth?","answer":"60 meters"},{"question":"What marine life can I see?","answer":"Sharks, rays, groupers, trevally, barracuda, fusiliers, snappers"},{"question":"When is the best time to dive?","answer":"March to May"}]

Transfer time: 15-45 minutes by speedboat from airport.", "distance": "50-100 km", "duration": "1-2 hours", "name": "Mal√© International Airport", "transferType": "Speedboat"}]
rows.nearbyDiveSites: [{"name":"Maaya Thila","distance":"0 km","difficulty":"Intermediate/Advanced","description":"One of the most famous dive sites in the Maldives, known for its vibrant reef, white-tip reef sharks, barracudas, and abundant marine life, especially during night dives."},{"name":"Fish Head (Mushimasmingili Thila)","distance":"8 km","difficulty":"Advanced","description":"A protected marine area renowned for its strong currents and large pelagic species like grey reef sharks, snappers, and schooling bannerfish. A thrilling drift dive."},{"name":"Broken Rock","distance":"12 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"Named for its distinctive canyon that splits the reef, offering unique swim-throughs. Home to soft corals, schooling fish, and occasional turtles."},{"name":"Bathalaa Thila","distance":"5 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"A smaller thila with excellent coral formations and a good chance to spot reef sharks, stingrays, and various macro life. Often done as a drift dive."},{"name":"Halaveli Wreck","distance":"15 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"A purpose-sunk cargo ship wreck, now an artificial reef teeming with marine life. Home to resident stingrays, groupers, and glassfish, offering a fascinating penetration opportunity for advanced divers."}]
rows.nearbySurfSpots: [{"name":"Cokes (Thulusdhoo)","distance":"70 km","difficulty":"Advanced","description":"A powerful, hollow right-hander breaking over a shallow reef. Best for experienced surfers seeking barrels. Requires a boat transfer to North Mal√© Atoll."},{"name":"Chickens (Thulusdhoo)","distance":"70 km","difficulty":"Intermediate/Advanced","description":"A long, fast left-hander, known for its long rides and consistent barrels. Can handle larger swells. Also located in North Mal√© Atoll, accessible by boat."},{"name":"Sultans (Himmafushi)","distance":"75 km","difficulty":"Intermediate","description":"A fun, consistent right-hand wave that offers long, carvable walls and occasional barrels. A popular spot for all levels, but especially intermediate surfers. Located in North Mal√© Atoll."}]
